review.reviewBody: Amazing amazing amazing! i knew the second that a tried this one i needed it! It is extremely comfortable, SO soft. I almost feel naked wearing it. I am 5’7”, 32D and got a medium and it fits great! The leggings don’t quite reach all the way to my ankles but that’s okay with me. It is very supportive and i feel like i can wear this to yoga!

review.name: Soft/ loose support

review.reviewBody:
I love the jumpsuit but need a smaller size Will return/exchange. 
Overall, I really do like the jumpsuit
review.name: I love the jumpsuit but

review.reviewBody: Love it! Like all of my BY purchases before… Soft, fits great and washes so well.
review.name: So good!

review.reviewBody: Cute and comfortable but I had to keep keep pulling to thighs up . But cute 🥰
review.name: Comfortable bit i kept having to pull the legs up

review.reviewBody: Super comfy love the fabric fit well and warm the length is just perfect even though I am 5.1 mostly others products are longer and I have to cut, mix it up with a top crop.. there we go 60s working out outfits . I love it and going to order more
review.name: Nice and warm for a chill day

review.reviewBody: I love this jumpsuit. I only wear earth tones so I always get whatever new color they have as long as it’s in the blues, greens and neutrals range. I’ve been buying BY jumpsuits for years and love the spacedye fabric because it’s incredibly supportive and soft. I wear them to hot yoga every morning and now that I am postpartum, I wear the black one on my days out of the house since it’s the only thing that fits out of my old clothes. Right now I’m a large since I just had a baby (currently 160 pounds), but I’m usually a size medium ( 5’8 and 145 pounds normally).
review.name: I love this jumpsuit. I

review.reviewBody: Aurora went the distance to find the pullover by opening several boxes and of course it was the last box that she would open to find the right size for me. Her smile, professionalism and personality along with her can do attitude was a a great enjoyment to be around. Our connected sarcasm was very much a highlight, over the penny I needed during the transaction to not get a bunch of change back was priceless. Anyways, the pullover is great and thanks to Aurora, I was able to get what I wanted and have a great experience at the same time.
review.name: Aurora was great!

review.reviewBody: I bought this in blue for my teenage daughter. We were shopping in a store and it was too cute to pass up - even though it is a “mens” jacket. It is even cuter in person and feels great on! Size small is a perfect fit and she is excited for colder weather.
review.name: Good for all

review.reviewBody:
Better than I thought it would be. Loved it in the pics online, but even better in person. 
Fits me like a glove 👌🏼
review.name: Awesome fit and style!

review.reviewBody: This was supposed to be a Father’s Day present but I’m glad my husband found out about it. I got his usual size XS for him and he tried it out. Shoulders, sleeves, and upper chest part fit as usual but the chest down was tight. The way it hugged the body was weird. Too bad. I liked the fabric, colors and feel of it, though.
review.name: Weird sizing and fit

review.reviewBody: I love this pullover. So warm and perfect for our camping trips!
review.name: Amazing Pullover

review.reviewBody: Excellent quality and style! Just is more of a jacket to wear a long period of time, not if you need to take it off frequently.
review.name: Excellent quality and style! Just

review.reviewBody:
This has to be one of the most comfortable pullovers/jackets that I’ve ever owned. It feels like a cloud on you but keeps you cool and warm. I walk with it every morning in 45° weather then it warms up into the 60’s and I still feel great. I don’t overheat.

The zipper zips way down on chest, there’s a side zip that almost reaches armpit so lots of ventilation. Kangaroo pocket is massive and has a zipper and then you also have open hand pocket behind the kangaroos pouch.

Water resistant and stain resistant as I already spilled coffee on it and it just wiped off!

I waited for this to be on sale and so not regret buying.

I bought TWO sizes up to have a very comfy loose fit. I can comfortably wear a hoodie under it or thermal or whatever and not feel like I’m suffocating.
review.name: Can’t believe I waited so long to order!

review.reviewBody: I got this jacket for $79.99 (kind of irrelevant I'm just still excited about the price). That said, the jacket is awesome! It is super comfortable and very warm. I really like the spice stripes color, it's not a bright orange more of a fall tone. I got a large, I'm 6' 2" and about 200 lbs. I could probably comfortably wear either the large or the XL.
review.name: Fuego Down Pullover

review.reviewBody: My son adores his new pullover. The fit is perfect and the color combination is different and fun! He loves the “super warm pockets”.
review.name: The Best Down Pullover

name: Fuego Down Pullover - Men's

review.reviewBody: Very, very small. I couldn't come close to wearing the L/XL and that was the largest size offered

Light weight.  Has enough storage to force one to be focused on what they carry.  Space for water, food and rain gear.  Needs more information on how to utilize tool carry points (ie, tippet, pliers, etc).  
I sold three older packs that have grown to heavy and carried to many items that I did not use and now only use this one.
review.name: Overall impressed

review.reviewBody: I love the pocket layout and the stealthy color scheme. Just enough room for all that you will ever need. I don't love the sizing and the absence of a 2xl for this line. This vest is very much a form-fitting piece of gear so order accordingly. Size up if you can unless you wear a 2xl. Then your just out of luck.
review.name: Great idea... terrible sizing.

review.reviewBody: Man I wanted this to be the one! I love almost everything about this vest, but the sizing isn't adequately roomy enough for a true xxl man like myself. If you're xxl, don't bother. Why ignore such a (ahem) large portion of your customers?
review.name: Xxl need not apply...

review.reviewBody: Really like the functionality of this vest/backpack. The front of your chest is clear giving you easy access to the zippers/pockets on the top of your waders. Backpack is large enough for a full day of "stuff" on the river. Used to use a hip pack and backpack. This is MUCH better. I went with the XL and it was perfect.
review.name: Great design by Simms

review.reviewBody: Good and accesible pocket  and handy good for hiking fishing
review.name: Flyaway vest pack

name: Flyweight Vest Pack

review.reviewBody: My go-to hat for work, hiking, travelling, and walking around the city.  Folds small in a pocket, durable and easy to wash.
review.name: Grady All-Around Cap

review.reviewBody: I am a fat head and it's hard to find a XL size, these fit. Wish that they came in a brown or tan.
review.name: Great for a Fat  Head

review.reviewBody: This hat is great in all kinds of weather, from hot sun to chilly fall days. It doesn't really provide much cold weather protection, but can work well to keep precipitation off when layered under a jacket hood. It also packs down nicely and can fit into a large jacket packet. It works well as a casual hat too, perfect style for grabbing a beer with friends or leading a revolution in a small country.
review.name: A Versatile Hat

review.reviewBody: This xl fits perfectly and is light weight so will dry quickly.
review.name: Light Weight

review.reviewBody: This hat is very light weight and comfortable and folds up easily and is very functional. It does not breat at all though. If there were a breathable option I would give it 5 stars.
review.name: Almost perfect

review.reviewBody: I love the foldable bill. Great feature. I also love the small bill size. The hat is a great material and handles sweat well. After washing It shrinks up just a touch then stretches back out. I jazzed with my purchase.
review.name: New Running/Hiking hat

review.reviewBody: 1. This hat does what it's supposed to do: it adds eye-cover from the sun. 2. The brim has a lower profile, rendering it less obtrusive than a lot of comparable ballcaps. 3. This is a stylish hat: I receive ongoing compliments whenever I wear it, it comes in a variety of colors, and it covers a bad-hair day with a great-hat day! 4. This hat is super lightweight and packable: It can fold up to fit in your pocket. 5. This hat is durable: I have had one for at least five years, worn it and washed it a ridiculous number of times, and while it's finally showing some signs of wear, I know it has at least a decade of use left in it. 6. Make sure you use a wash-and-dry cycle for it to fit properly.
review.name: The Everything Hat

review.reviewBody: Love Outdoor Research products.  All are practical and built tough.
review.name: Great hat!

review.reviewBody: Completely satisfied with this hat. Is lightweight, dries quickly and you can stuff it into your pocket when you're done
review.name: Most comfortable hat I've ever worn

review.reviewBody: Its a great comfortable unique hat - I have two. But you need a bit of color in the mix!!
review.name: Bring back the blue colour please

name: Radar Pocket Cap

review.itemreviewed: Sawtooth X Low B-Dry Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Oboz use to be my "go to" hiking shoe but something has happened with this company, probably after they got acquired from the original Oboz owners. Shoe is stiff and uncomfortable. I used to be able to put on Oboz out of the box and start trekking.  No anymore!  I've had multiple pairs in the past that were super comfy, supportive, great arch, etc.  Not anymore.  Returned these
review.name: Disappointing

review.itemreviewed: Sawtooth X Low B-Dry Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I’ve had time to wear them enough they fit perfectly the first time I put my foot into them a size them as I would if I were buying an athletic shoe. Very pleased.
review.name: waterproof for hiking, walking, wet trails

review.itemreviewed: Sawtooth X Low B-Dry Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I have narrow, low volume, high arch feet that are falling apart in my late 60's (plantar fasciitis, sesamoiditis, other mysterious pains) .  I tried a couple styles in Salomon, and Ryka, with poor results.  My feet, knees, and spine are happy in these shoes!  I went on a 5-day hiking trip with rooty/rocky narrow trails, and everything worked well!  I agree totally with the other two reviewers on this site!  I am so thankful I found these shoes with their deep heel cup and sole that doesn't force me to feel every rock in the trail, and keeps me secure and steady and comfortable.  Thank the universe for Oboz Sawtooth X Low B-Dry Shoe!  Comfortable out of the box.  I wear them with Darn Tough Hiker Boot Full Cushion Sock.  Happy feet!
review.name: So Glad I Found These

review.itemreviewed: Sawtooth X Low B-Dry Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I love the great arch support right out of the box. These shoes are comfortable but have a performance fit that allows me to feel confident on the trail. The narrow heel prevents blisters and extra movement where there shouldn’t be.
review.name: Amazing Fit

review.itemreviewed: Sawtooth X Low B-Dry Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: This is a great fitting hiking shoe.  I have plantar  fasciitis and these shoes are so comfortable you will not regret owning a pair!  I have the lupine and slate colors and they are so beautiful with a pair of blue jeans or Fjallraven hiking pants.  I am normally a 7.5 in most running shoes and a size 8 medium in Oboz fits perfectly.  Can’t say enough good about this shoe, its one of the best fitting shoes I’ve ever tried.
review.name: Beautiful, comfortable hiking shoe!

name: Sawtooth X Low B-Dry Shoe - Women's

review.reviewBody: I wore it one time and the friction between the material and my seat belt ruined the pullover. You can clearly see from should across chest pilling/rubbing from my seatbelt. What a waste of money. Should have went with Columbia for 1/3 the price
review.name: GARBAGE PRODUCT IF YOU PLAN TO WEAR IT

review.reviewBody: the R1 is an ideal underlayer that can serve many uses - under a shell in moderate weather, it is warm, especially with activity - paired with a puffer or something more substantial, it can be a great underlayer - on 40 degree days that are warming into the 60s, it's ideal to transition wiht.
review.name: perfect transition fleece

review.reviewBody:
The shirt fits tight but that is the design. This creates a very warm shirt. I was in Colorado in December 2023 with the weather being around 20 degrees or less. The R1 was perfect for such cold weather, especially with another layer of clothing. I quickly purchased another one. 
Highly recommend this product.
review.name: Outstanding shirt for cold weather!

review.reviewBody: I generally get one of these every year, to replace my oldest in the rotation.  Not sure what the gent below me is referring to, since the cuffs on these garments has remained the same for years. These are great for a wicking base>mid layer, depending on the temperature.  I like them for morning climbs when it's a little windy & chilly.  They also look great for lounging around or out on the town.  Got the Obsidian color this year and have received a few compliments on the fit & color.  DO NOT TOSS INTO THE DRYER!  Not necessary! Oh, BTW:  The "techie" face on the outside enables slipping your arms into a shell or jacket.  Keep 'em coming, Patagonia; and maybe bring back the Casco Orange.  I foolishly missed that color that year.
review.name: Tried & True

review.reviewBody:
I'm 5'5", 135lb, with ~34" chest and 29" waist.

I'm often between an XS and S depending on the brand -- I just got an XS that fit, but was definitely tight. I'll be sizing up to the size S. The sleeves are a bit too long on the Small, but I think that's the right compromise for something that I'll be wearing for active sports.

Haven't used it yet at all, but it feels super lightweight and relatively warm!
review.name: Smaller guy size review

review.reviewBody: Bought as a gift for my fiance. He used it once for inbounds resort skiing at Big Sky and one of the poles bent on the first day. So we absolutely do not recommend for durability and quality (his prior poles lasted a decade). Emailed Backcountry warranty to let them know, and they said that aluminum poles bend easily (as if this is a well-known issue) and for this reason, it's not covered. The item description doesn't indicate any of this so want to help others avoid wasting $45 and a few weeks of frustration.
review.name: Bent the first time it was used

hasVariant.name: Heat Exchanger
hasVariant.description: Buy the MSR Heat Exchanger online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Beyond what everyone has already mentioned, when the MSR HE is used with a Titan pot and Dragonfly stove, it happens to fit perfectly just to the outside of the stove’s pot supports.  So beyond the added efficiencies for fuel use, it also creates a much more stable pan to stove connection.  This is actually one of the things I like most about it.
review.name: An additional benefit….

review.reviewBody: Never leave without it. I use this for the ceramic 2.5 pot, and it fits perfect. Though the wheel was lame when I purchased it, it was easily fixed. Once adjusted, it saves up to 20% while keeping the wind away. Stowing while travelling is easy. I wrap it around a therm-a-rest, and tighten it with a strap.
review.name: HE

review.reviewBody: Wasted money. I love MSR gear. Sharp bulky and hard to stow. It has to have some good points.
review.name: No. I would not buy this product again.

review.reviewBody: I already own one, but cannot find it. The Heat Exchanger is an essential tool for efficient cooking in a cold or winter environment. Thank you!
review.name: Essential tool for cold weather cooking

review.reviewBody: I use it all the time. It would be better if I could roll it up. A mesh metal or dragon skin would do that nicely. Hard to fit in backpack without the worry of it bending oddly. Remember your customer has discretionary money to burn, mountains to climb, and an ego to feed.
review.name: Good, give me more.

review.reviewBody: I ran into the heat exchanger while climbing Denali the first time back in 1985. Other teams were carrying a pressure cooker(!) to help with high altitude cooking times. We (The Innocents Abroad team of 1985) choose to go with the HE to conserve on the fuel we had to haul up for our EGK expedition stoves...nothing like having to melt ice for water at 17,000'. We found that using the HE to keep the pot warm at -40 degrees allowed us to 'simmer' our food and stretch out our fuel supply during a 10 day storm at high camp. I recall something about 90 know winds blowing a climbers boots away (forever) from her tent door.
review.name: I ran into the heat exchanger while climbing Denali the

review.reviewBody: My wife and I have been using one of these for more than 20 years. They work really well at directing heat the pot. Benefits are: 1) water is boiling faster so less time cooking. 2) uses less fuel so don't need to carry as much AND don't need to buy as much. We always take it with us when backpacking, including internationally, but also use it car camping. And I've used it in the kitchen when our kettle went out. Product just makes so much sense. Product fits into the msr cookset along with the stove, so is no extra space to pack.
review.name: No-Brainer product has paid for itself many times

review.reviewBody: This speeds up boiling water and extends your fuel. Great product.
review.name: Works well

review.reviewBody: I have had this for many years, works great Don't use as a wind break lol Blew a hole through one, using my dragonfly stove. But it was replaced and never had another issue
review.name: Awesome accessorie

review.reviewBody: Works well to help focus that side heat from the stove into the pot.
review.name: Works well to focus heat where it belongs

name: Heat Exchanger

review.reviewBody: Fast rope for rappeling. Knots well. A bit more stretch than I wanted, but not a problem.
review.name: Great rope

review.reviewBody: Has worked really well at Devil’s lake.  Durable and pliable.
review.name: Great for anchors

review.reviewBody: I got this for top rope soloing.  It feels safe and feeds nicely.  I have also used it to make a zipline for the kids and it worked well for that too.
review.name: Good for TRS

review.reviewBody: This is my new go to for static rope! It's a very soft rope out of the box and I really like the red and black color scheme.
review.name: Great rope!

review.reviewBody: Easy to work with and knot. Used for ascent and rappel. Sheath is good, prusiks and ascenders work well with this diameter 10.5. Grigri and atc friction good. Bionic 8 twists this rope ymmv.

Static line is solid, wear resistant and easy to handle. Some statics are too stiff and difficult to tie knots with - not this one! I got mine in black which is fine but it does make it a little harder to see and work with after sundown.
review.name: Exactly as Expected

review.reviewBody: Beautiful handling and reliability - key reasons Mammut ropes are always my go to. Used to build top rope anchors.
review.name: Mammut always reliable

review.reviewBody:
Despite the EN 1891 Type A rating, this rope is probably not appropriate for any of industrial access, canyoning, or caving. It is a fairly high-elongation static rope (I couldn't find an official spec anywhere, but in a test I estimated it to be 9% elongation; one random website I found listed 7%): this makes it extremely unpleasant to frog up, and very sensitive to potential wear points without excessive padding.

The bright side is: it's very supple and knottable, feels quite solid, and gives an excellent rappel. If that's all you need from it, or you plan to use it for hauling, it'll serve quite well.
review.name: Handles nicely, but not very static

name: Performance Static Rope - 10.5mm

review.reviewBody: I have work Giro shoes for the past 10 years so I don’t know why I had hesitation about these. The toe box is room and my SPD cleats do not click around while walking. I changes the laces to so quick lace locks but other than that- 2 thumbs up.
review.name: Surprising good!

review.reviewBody:
I had a trip to cycle across Europe planned and since I was carrying all of my stuff on my bike, I needed a shoe that could be for cycling and for walking around. 
My MTB shoes were too stiff and not great to walk in for very long, and road shoes weren’t an option. I tried a pair of adidas sambas that were also cycling shoes but they had a hot spot I couldn’t eliminate or ignore. So I went out on a limb and decided to buy these. 
I can’t say enough good things about these shoes. I rode miles in these and walked miles in these and they did everything I needed them to do and remained comfortable the whole time. 

I highly recommend these shoes for any use whether you’re cycle touring, MTB’ing or spinning. Hell, I’m gonna try racing in them next month because why not? 

Get ‘em. You will be pleasantly surprised.
review.name: Wonderful shoe

review.reviewBody:
I loved these shoes literally to death. They were really great for commuting to work for a solid year, every day. Very comfortable to walk around and I didn’t get called out in the office for wearing cycling shoes. One plus is that the cleats are nicely recessed so they don’t really click on the ground all the time. They also were great for road and gravel duty and were very comfortable over long rides up to 120 miles. I fit well in a 45 when I’m normally a 44. This is what they look like after close to 3000 miles about half of which was off road and they went downhill fast in the last 100 mtb miles. 
Things to note: they’re not super stiff, which means they’re great for walking. Also I wouldn’t take them on proper MTB rides, I basically destroyed them when I used them as a stand when I was it between mtb shoes. They also failed in the same place on both shoes (top of the mesh). 

Overall I would buy another pair (and probably will!) because they’re great value and work so well for commuting.
review.name: Excellent shoes

review.reviewBody: I was looking for a spd shoe that passed for and  functioned as a standard sneaker.  These nail it.  The cleats do make contact with the ground so there is a little noise walking but overall very nice.  Feel like quality build and good in the saddle.
review.name: Great shoe for my single speed

name: Rumble VR Cycling Shoe - Men's

hasVariant.description: Buy the Platypus Hoser Reservoir online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: For me, this has the same foul taste of every other bladder I’ve owned. I clean things well and live a healthy lifestyle, so I don’t think it’s me. Also, it leaks a bit, no matter how tightly I close it. Also very hard to fill with river water on the go. Disappointing.
review.name: Not taste free

review.reviewBody: Well made and affordable. Could use a shutoff for the mouth piece to prevent leakage. Still good value for what you get.
review.name: Good value.

review.reviewBody:
The material is very good quality, I don't taste the plastic used. Though I have a few issues with design:
1. I have to take off the hose to refill it. This is a pain when doing a long hike, taking up time and making organization difficult. This also makes it harder to clean. 
2. There is no cover for the mouth piece. Whenever I have to set my bag down it gets dirt and dust all over it.
review.name: Not bad, Not Great

review.reviewBody:
Had my Platy for many years and its absolutely brilliant. Still fresh clear tasting water. 
Now looking for a 2nd one for my daughter for our bike journeys so she stops trying to drink all my water
review.name: Fantastic

review.reviewBody: Hi there's no actual hole in it- how do I get the water through? I don't want to stab it with a knife...
review.name: hyflo bite valve has no hole

review.reviewBody: Gave these to 4 people at Christmas time..... they were very pleased because they said the old ones had a stale taste.... won’t be used for a number of months
review.name: Yet to be used

review.reviewBody: Great lightweight and easy to use reservoir. Durable and we like the bite valve versus the one u have to manipulate to open
review.name: The best one we have used

review.reviewBody: Beats heck out of the jury rigged soft-bottle I’d been using. Ensures I stay better hydrated. Light as heck. Tip: Just ensure the hose, where it exits the cap, is routed in the plane of the reservoir and not at an angle.
review.name: $ well spent

review.reviewBody: I have had my Platypus Hoser for more than 15 years now and it still works great. It's the two liter version, very similar to this one. No complaints ever, easy to clean, light weight, and very durable. My version even has "patent pending" still on it. And a logo with a Platypus illustration, which I love! Thanks @Platypus for all these years of joyful and well-hydrated hiking and biking thanks to the Hoser :)
review.name: Lasts forever, amazing product

review.reviewBody: On my holiday in the US I bought an new hoser reservoir 3L in an outdoorshop. Unfortunately it turned out that the connecting part was ruptured, must be damaged when still in the package. So when I put in water it sprayed out. Unfortunately I cannot use it because of this leakage. And because we are travelling I also cannot go to the store I bought it.
review.name: Lucienne

name: Hoser Reservoir

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I bought black size Medium. I’m 5’8”, 150. The fit and length are great for me, even the arm length. It is not a tapered at waist or tight jacket. I like it because I play outdoor paddle tennis in the winter and this allows free movement of my arms, even with two layers underneath. I actually start to heat up and can remove this piece after a set. It’s so light, I just ball it up and stuff it in my backpack! Super warm and lightweight! I recommend it!
review.name: Light Weight but Warm

review.reviewBody: A versatile lightweight jacket I can wear on hikes and for my commute to the mountains.  Also works as a baselayer under a larger/heavier jacket.  Love the color too.
review.name: Been looking for this!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Nice light weight but warm jacket. I'm partial to a jacket that covers my butt, but this is a really nice jacket and I tend to grab it often too run the dog outside to use the bathroom. Would recommend to others.
review.name: Nice jacket

review.itemreviewed: Free Aero RC Kit Bib Short - Men's
review.reviewBody:
The shorts do run small…as others have reviewed go with one size larger. 
Great riding shorts, you won’t be disappointed.
review.name: Great Bib Shorts!

review.itemreviewed: Free Aero RC Kit Bib Short - Men's
review.reviewBody: Been through a zillion bibs from multiple companies. I’ve had some good ones along the way and some not so good. These are the real deal - going on 3 pairs now and will buy some to put up for when I need a new set. No issues to date and have put legit miles on 2 pairs. Normal Castelli sizing. I’m 6’ 220, 36” waste and I’m doing 2XL in these - not too small but no way I could go smaller. They got these right.
review.name: Yes

review.itemreviewed: Free Aero RC Kit Bib Short - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Great bibs, Castelli run small so make sure you size up. I love the compression and the fit and especially the pad for me. I think it’s the best one I have. I have other high-end brands and for long-distance comfort this one is the best.  
The one problem I do have is the straps are too short. I have a friend that is a seamstress and I had her length in the straps. This might be a problem for others, but to me it was worth it.
review.name: Castelli, Free aero RC bibs.

review.itemreviewed: Free Aero RC Kit Bib Short - Men's
review.reviewBody: Really enjoy these bibs. Great chamois!! I bought these because I have other Castelli bibs and really enjoy their products. Well-made  Shoulder straps are nice and wide so the pressure is not concentrated in one narrow area. Fits well all over doesn’t ride up. Check the size chart. Castelli tends to run tighter than other bibs.
review.name: Great chamois!!

name: Free Aero RC Kit Bib Short - Men's

review.reviewBody: I used this NF Explore Hop pack daily as I tend to misplace my wallet and/or credit cards. Now, my 11-year-old has taken it over and uses it every day. It's a great pack to have on your body. It does not take up too much space, and is lightweight and durable!

review.itemreviewed: Fenix 7X Pro Sapphire Solar Sport Watch
review.reviewBody: I bought this about a month and a half ago, and I love the watch!!! It has some much capability it’s mind boggling!!! From the GPS, to the ECG apps, it’s truly an amazing watch!!!
review.name: My Review for Fēnix® 7X Pro – Sapphire

review.itemreviewed: Fenix 7X Pro Sapphire Solar Sport Watch
review.reviewBody:
The Garmin Fenix 7 Pro Sapphire is an outstanding tool for anyone balancing endurance and strength training. Its durable build, long-lasting battery, and accurate GPS make it perfect for intense training weeks and trail runs. Advanced metrics like heart rate, VO2 max, and recovery advisor help optimize performance, while multi-sport modes seamlessly track both running and lifting.

During technical trail race courses, the gps tool has saved my race several times and kept me safe while solo training. I’m a smaller female, so adapting to the larger watch size after upgrading from a vivoactive 4s took some time. I have seen a positive increase in my training outcomes since upgrading. Great tool for hunting and additional outdoor activities!

This watch is more than a fitness tracker—it’s a reliable training partner that supports diverse athletic goals. Highly recommend it for hybrid athletes who want top-tier features and durability.
review.name: Garmin Fenix 7 Pro Sapphire – Perfect for Hybrid A

review.itemreviewed: Fenix 7X Pro Sapphire Solar Sport Watch
review.reviewBody: Just had for less than two weeks. Battery is still good  and golf app if great
review.name: Great watch

review.itemreviewed: Fenix 7X Pro Sapphire Solar Sport Watch
review.reviewBody: Very happy with it. I thought it was going to be too much for me but I am happy to have the extra applications.
review.name: Top of the line sports watch!

review.itemreviewed: Fenix 7X Pro Sapphire Solar Sport Watch
review.reviewBody: I love this watch for all the activities I do. The sensor are very accurate
review.name: Way better than my Fenix 5x

review.itemreviewed: Fenix 7X Pro Sapphire Solar Sport Watch
review.reviewBody: As I spend time I’m getting the hang of how to get things working.
review.name: Sequence of the controls is making sense.

review.itemreviewed: Fenix 7X Pro Sapphire Solar Sport Watch
review.reviewBody: I changed charging cables at least 2 times but having tough time to hold the cable to charge. I loose tge power with little move and the watch has to be in one particular position
review.name: Charging sucks

review.itemreviewed: Fenix 7X Pro Sapphire Solar Sport Watch
review.reviewBody: Initially the watch would not hold the watch face I wanted to use, and just in general was not as consistent as my Fenix 6X Pro. I reset the watch to defaults and for a second time did an update to the software. After manually resetting all of my settings, the watch has been flawless and is exactly what I hoped for. I am very happy with the purchase.
review.name: Great watch, rough start

review.itemreviewed: Fenix 7X Pro Sapphire Solar Sport Watch
review.reviewBody: I upgraded from a Fenix 5.  I'm still In the process of getting it set up how I want it.  So far I really like it. Besides all that can do, I especially like the flash light feature.  And that it pairs with in-reach.  I hunt alot and use many of the fenix"s  capabilities.
review.name: Best watch

review.itemreviewed: Fenix 7X Pro Sapphire Solar Sport Watch
review.reviewBody: I really enjoy my garmin watch. It has a lot of really cool features. There are tons of faces to choose from to make it unique. Definitely recommend.
review.name: Pretty nice

name: Fenix 7X Pro Sapphire Solar Sport Watch

review.reviewBody: This is my go to glove for when weather gets bad.  Fit is spot on.  I have worn them in rainy ski conditions and was perfectly dry.  I have worn them into the high single digits,and was warm to the tips of my fingers.  1 negative they should come with leashes.  Highly recommend
review.name: Awesome

review.reviewBody: Toasty warm gloves. Super grippy palm & fingers. I expect the leather palm to stand the test of time.
review.name: Warm & grippy

review.reviewBody: This is by far the best shoe for climbing 12s or higher with a wide foot
review.name: Climbing 12s

review.reviewBody:
Scarpa really did us a disservice. This shoe is not the technical, small-edge machine it used to be. It feels just like so many other shoes on the market. 
Note that all scarpa big wall athletes still do their hardest sends in og Boostics to this day....
review.name: No longer the micro edging machine :(

review.reviewBody: The new boostic is a great shoe, but it will be disappointing for those who loved the old model for its support.  The new version is a very different shoe that is quite a bit softer.  Sad to see such a drastic change.
review.name: Not the same shoe:(
comment: Hey Nick! Thanks for the feedback. Good to know that Scarpa changed this shoe to be a softer shoe; I'm imagining this new model could be better for steep climbing!

review.reviewBody:
I never owned the old version, so I can?t make a comparison between the two. But I really like these shoes. They are confidence inspiring. I can stand on tiny  footholds and not worry about it. 
It?s nice to see a stiff performance shoe for a change. I like soft shoes for steep indoor climbing. But I definitely prefer a stiffer more supportive shoe for climbing outdoors. I?ve been using these for about a month now. They required almost zero break in. The sizing is pretty consistent with the other Scarpa shoes I?ve owned. To me, they seem like they run a little smaller than the Vapors. Maybe 1 full size at the most. I wear a 45.5 in Vapor V?s. And I got 45?s in the Boostic. And I wear a size 12 street shoe. The 45?s are a good and tight fit on my feet. And they don?t hurt my feet either.  I?ve used them all day long on a couple weekend sport climbing trips, and my feet never bothered me. I have definitely found my new favorite climbing shoes.
review.name: Great Shoes!

review.reviewBody: Much softer than the old parrot Boostic. It's no longer uniquely supportive for routes w/ lots of tiny feet; now is very similar to many other shoes like Instinct, Muira VS, Otaki, etc. Out of that field the VS is my favorite. Sad to see the old not be replaced even though new is good shoe in its own right
review.name: Totally different
comment: How did you size these compared to the Muira VS?

name: Boostic Climbing Shoe

review.reviewBody:
I've found the Forager to be a great waterproof pouch so far. My only complaint is that it is just a little too big to fit the waterproof waist pack's waist belt. It would be nice to have a waterproof pocket that would fit on the waist belt as a modular system to increase the capacity and utility of the waterproof waist pack.

Also, this pouch is totally flat when empty, which can nice for its low profile, However, one with a little more depth, like a thin box, could be more useful.
review.name: A great waterproof pouch

review.reviewBody: We're super glad we upgraded to this sleeping bag for our car camping trips in the White Mountains. My partner and I also have backpacking bags, but decided the space saving advantages weren't a top priority when we're staying at state parks. If you have room in your vehicle, it's definitely worth the swap. The packed size of this bag in the stuff sack is massive though - much larger than the tent we use. A compression sack might help a little. We love how comfy this is, and the hood that fits bed pillows is awesome. I am a side sleeper and my partner is a stomach sleeper, so this is a huge improvement for getting better sleep. The attached blankets ensure no drafts if someone is a blanket hog.
review.name: Great car camping bag for couples

review.reviewBody: My partner and I recently bought this for car camping. Love the versatility enabling each side to tailor their own temperature (take off the blanket, stick your feet out the bottom, etc). Really wish the two blankets within had a way of connecting, as we found during the night they can slip off, which left me a bit cold, but as long as I had it snug, it worked and I was comfortable, and we loved that we could cuddle throughout the night. We've only used it for 3 nights, with the lowest at ~45F. It took up the entire footprint of my 2 person backpacking tent and feels a bit silly, but is a luxury and we are looking forward to using it more!
review.name: Love the versatility

review.reviewBody: This this is awesome! My boyfriend is 6ft 4 and has PLENTY of room. We love the double blanket situation and it’s so warm and cozy. The feel flap is a game changer and also allows our dogs to get some snuggling too.
review.name: Best sleeping bag ever

review.reviewBody: my wife an I used this in ~35d and windy weather in a 3 season tent, stayed warm and was large enough to roll over and not bother each others sleep.  Paired with the Kush Air Bed (KELO0A7-CASROC-QUE) and had one of the best nights sleep.   I highly recommend this for a 2 person bag.  It is large when packed away, but you can sleep together with your partner.
review.name: Best 2 person bag

review.reviewBody: My partner and I loved this sleeping bag. It rained one of the nights that we went camping and it kept us dry and super warm, even when our tent got a little wet. My favorite thing about it was the head because I liked being under it to keep the heat in. I also enjoyed the separate blanket that’s underneath because I get hot easily while my partner doesn’t, so it was nice to have that separation. However, I agree that there could’ve been an attachment for the pieces to come together for those who prefer to have that choice. But we just improvised and put a warm blanket inside. Overall I’d rate it a solid 9/10.
review.name: MY FAVORITE SLEEPING BAG SO FAR!

review.reviewBody:
As a two-person sleeping bag under $200, I recommend it. That said, they missed a few easy improvements that would have made it so much better. 
Here is some free advice, Kelty. The internal blankets are nice, but they fall off easily. Why not include a way to connect them together on colder nights? It would also be nice to have a way to sinch up the bag around the shoulders with some form of draw-string. Currently, the only way to keep cold drafts from coming in is to stuff jackets in the large spaces around the shoulder area. 
I will be adding my own velcro to attach the blankets but even with this improvement, this bag has no business existing below 35 degrees F for most people.
review.name: Good, not great.

review.reviewBody: Ordered this from Backcountry and used it over the past week in Kentucky where it was in the low 40s at night and was really impressed. It was warm - almost too warm at those temperatures. It's my first time using a double sleeping bag and I love that there was a bit of room to move around even with my partner in, and it's not as constricted as a regular mum bag. I thought the internal flaps would be awkward but they worked really well, I wrapped them around myself and they stayed in place all night. Highly recommend this sleeping bag.
review.name: Really Impressed

review.reviewBody: I've been living in my truck camper with my 3 dogs for the last 20 months. We're on our second winter in Utah and this thing has been wonderful. All four of us snuggle in the bag every winter night. Have also been backpacking with it, which isn't ideal as it's pretty bulky, but we made it work by strapping to the outside of our 55l pack and it worked well keeping us all snug as a bug in the mountains, mid summer, mind you. Definitely a great car camping with your significant other or pets kind of bag.
review.name: Love this thing!!!

review.reviewBody: This was a perfect addition to our camping gear. We took it car camping in the Tetons and it was spacious and so warm! Temps got down to the 20s at night and we were very comfortable(until I had to get out lol). The double blankets can be a little awkward to get situated, but in the morning I found myself completely wrapped up in it and cozy. I am 5'10 and plus size, my partner is 'average' size. We had plenty of room!
review.name: Such a great sleeping bag

review.reviewBody: Ski area is 1.5 hours away.  Round trips are doable but expensive for muti-day pow shots. Motels are either ancient or expensive. Solution? Take my dwelling with me. A trailer would be nice - if it was four-season, off-road/winter-road capable. Again, expensive. Truck-tent was my solution. Need a decent 3-season bag (we can always add layers). Solution? Kelty?s Tru.Comfort Doublewide. I love it - wife loves it. Problem solved!
review.name: Perfect For Our Needs

review.itemreviewed: Out N About IV Chillz Waterproof Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Took them to Alaska and they were not warm enough. Good and really cute shoe but not great for snow and really cold conditions (20 degrees and below). They don’t have good treads and they aren’t that warm. I was slipping on the snow. They are sturdy, quality material and definitely waterproof. So I will wear them often just not in extreme cold. I ordered a half size up so I could wear bulky socks and they fit really well.

review.reviewBody: This is the greatest merino baselayer I have ever used. I have smartwool, icebreaker, outdoor research, costco; this is the one I grab for ski days & days that matter. It is expensive, but totally worth it. My only gripe is the position of the thumb holes. I find myself using them to see my watch more than keep the sleeves in place since it's relatively slim fitting. The slim wrist means it doesn't twist well to see my watch, but that's not what it's for. . .
review.name: The best!

review.reviewBody: Awesome piece of techwear but too small and fitted to be worn as anything but a base layer. I sized using my exact measurements across my chest and it’s really tight. No room for shrink. Not usable for anything besides sport base layer, which is a bit disappointing.
review.name: Awesome piece of techwear but

review.reviewBody: Already my favorite. Warm, comfy and you can wear it for days with no stench.
review.name: This is the baselayer !

review.reviewBody: Had the quarter zip hoody - had to add this. Great weight and feel. Love the merino (more options like these please - short sleeve??)
review.name: Had the quarter zip hoody

review.reviewBody: After trying the Solution 150 you won’t want to wear anything else !
review.name: Love it !

review.reviewBody: I love this shirt! I use under my soccer jersey, as a base/mid layer under my shell for skiing and sometimes I just wear it as a shirt to school.
review.name: Superb Baselayer

review.reviewBody: The men’s Solution 150 is a great layer by itself, and under winter time clothing. I recommend this quality shirt.
review.name: Great

review.reviewBody: Loved my first one so much I bought a second in a different color. Does everything you expect from wool in a quality shirt.
review.name: Great fit and super comfortable

review.reviewBody:
I’m 6’1” 169lbs. 
I have 2 of these in medium. 
Thumb holes are great. 
Would be perfect if it was 2” longer in the torso. But that hasn’t stopped me from buying it again!
review.name: Great fit soft feel

review.reviewBody:
Hard-wearing, great base layer. Use mostly for paragliding.

I am 6'1" and 190 pounds. I ordered both a large and an XL. 

In T-shirts and dress shirts, I wear an XL due to my broad shoulders and lats from surfing.

The Large was a bit tight and cut under my arms at first, but it relaxed and fits perfectly now with a non-binding/ non-cutting trim fit.

The XL was perfect for the first few wearings, but with washing, it is now baggy and a bit stretched out in the neck.

I layer the two if needing extra warmth. But if wearing a single base/mid layer, I choose and prefer the Large. 

I normally can not tolerate wool against my skin. These are soft and fine, but usually wear a Coolmax under in summer or a Capilene under in winter.
review.name: Great Base/ Mid layer

name: Solution 150 Merino Base Crew - Men's

hasVariant.description: Buy the Gregory Arrio 22L Backpack online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: To say I have a few backpacks would be an understatement. And as my amazing wife says about her shoes, each pair has its purpose, I can say the same about my collection of backpacks.  This particular pack was purchased specifically for a summer trip with the family in anticipation of extremely warm weather so I was looking for a small pack (around 20L) that had a suspended vented back panel,  as I am the designated "Sherpa" for all items needed throughout the day as well anything purchased, this pack was perfect for our day to day walk through the sites we were visiting,  holds everybody's extra items as well as 2.5 liters of cold water with plenty of room to spare.  Was between this and the Osprey Hikelite and ultimately chose this for ability to stuff a layer in the draw cord on the front as well as extra side pocket in line of a second water bottle space.  Only gripe is the small front pocket is just a bit too small for what I like to keep in it typically.  Never go wrong with Gregory products or with purchasing from Backcountry.
review.name: Great small summer pack.

review.reviewBody: Nice pack, good for flying and hiking. Fits under plane seat.
review.name: Compact pack that fits the essentials and is comfy

review.reviewBody: This pack fits all my needs for my daily commute. It’s light, and tough as nails. And I got free embroidery so I can always find it. My name is Gregory!
review.name: Great pack for day trips!

review.reviewBody: Highly recommend!! Beautiful color, useful function for mountain climbing.
review.name: Highly recommend!!

review.reviewBody:
I've only done a handful of day hikes with this pack, but from the very first hike it's been comfortable. More comfortable than the ultralight pack it replaced, and the one I used after the ultralight pack wore out and I tried to use instead of buying new. 
The suspended mesh back panel was a big selling point, and it does work: in January we hiked for three days in Palo Duro Canyon State Park, one day about six miles and two days about 11 miles each.  Snow on the ground, winds blowing, and when I warmed up enough to take my jacket off, the breeze was clearly felt on my back. Warm hikes (next week in Death Valley) is where this feature will truly shine.
The hydration sleeve and tube routing is excellent, with a hanger that works with my Camelbak bladder.  Carry with about 15 pounds is light and balanced and I didn't need to use the hip belt.  Each of the 11 mile days saw no discomfort during the day or once we'd finished for the day, which my last few day packs can't claim.
I bought this based on 2.5 decades of Gregory pack use (dating to my Weekender and Robson packs), during which time I used other company's day packs, but, came back to Gregory when I read through this spec sheet.  An excellent pack more than worth consideration.
review.name: Comfortable Carry

review.reviewBody: Biggest drawback to this bag is the side mesh pocket. It is poorly designed so that it does not properly hold a water bottle.  Normal sized water bottles easily fall out.  The weight of the bag is nice and light. Good air circulation on the back and fits well over shoulders.
review.name: Arrio 22 is overall nice bag

review.reviewBody: Finally, I've found a bag I really do like. I've been through way to many bags before finding what I wanted. The 22L suits me just fine. I carry my small mirrorless setup in this bag. Along with that, I can throw in an extra layer if needed too, plus snacks, and a small organizer pack. The side pocket does become cramped for me because of the camera insert I have inside. There is less give thus making the bottom portion of the pocket useless but that isn't a big deal to me. I use the top pouch to hold my keys and a Leatherman. I haven't tried putting my Nalgene in the mesh side pocket but I did ask Gregory about the bladder for this bag and it will fit either the 2 or 3 liter. Also, having the back panel away from your back is nice so as not to become a sweaty mess. Overall, I like the bag and it fits me just fine. I'm 6'3", 250lbs, with a 19" torso if that helps anyone. 4 stars and I would recommend this to anyone looking for a nice day pack.
review.name: Great bag and purchase

review.reviewBody: Really pleased with the way this pack wears, feels, and looks. Nice design that feels really built.
review.name: Really nice light pack.

review.reviewBody: I was gifted this bag and I love it! The material feels like great quality and has been very durable thus far. The straps are comfortable and feels nice when I'm walking / hiking. I will be buying another for my fiance for work!
review.name: Super comfy and functional!

name: Arrio 22L Backpack

review.itemreviewed: Capilene Cool Daily Short-Sleeve Shirt - Women's
review.reviewBody: Awesome shirt! So cool! Love all the colors
review.name: Women’s cool daily cap

review.itemreviewed: Capilene Cool Daily Short-Sleeve Shirt - Women's
review.reviewBody: It alows me to move free in my zumba class and keeps me cool.  I love the longer length of this top.  I have several of the long sleeves for sun protection.
review.name: My favorite material to be active in!

review.itemreviewed: Capilene Cool Daily Short-Sleeve Shirt - Women's
review.reviewBody: This is my fourth Caprilene shirt. I wear them for hikes, walks, all workouts. They are styled right; not too tight or too boxy. The sleeves can be a bit tight and it’s best to was them right after a workout as they tend to retain odors.
review.name: Love this shirt!

review.itemreviewed: Capilene Cool Daily Short-Sleeve Shirt - Women's
review.reviewBody: I recently bought a couple of these for climbing and I almost love them. However, the cut is a little strange for an athletic body. The sleeves are quite tight, but the waist is loose, and the shirt is a bit long so it needs to be tucked in so as not to get caught up in my harness. Super comfy fabric though, perfect for SoCal spring and summer (and fall and sometimes winter).
review.name: Great feel, slightly odd cut

review.itemreviewed: Capilene Cool Daily Short-Sleeve Shirt - Women's
review.reviewBody: Lightweight, cool, and comfortable which makes for a great shirt to hike in.
review.name: Love it

review.itemreviewed: Capilene Cool Daily Short-Sleeve Shirt - Women's
review.reviewBody: I have several of these shirts and love them. This is a classic t-shirt fit but the fabric has a bit of a drape to it so it doesn't come across as boxy. The fabric is smooth and light with a very slight sheen to it. Great over a swim suit or on a hot day. I'm 5'7" 112 lbs 34A chest and the size small fits great. I suspect the xs would have also worked well albeit a slimmer fit.
review.name: Excellent

review.itemreviewed: Capilene Cool Daily Short-Sleeve Shirt - Women's
review.reviewBody: Can you be in love with a shirt? Light, cool, perfect. I tend to be a medium in most Patagonia things, but I ended up exchanging for a small. The medium still fit fine but a little baggier than I wanted. I'm 5'3, 135lbs with a 'thicker' build. Small fits like a glove and is the perfect length. Love the fabric against my skin. My only beef is that they don't have other darker colors apart from black. The shirt is thin, so it's slightly see-through.
review.name: In Love

review.itemreviewed: Capilene Cool Daily Short-Sleeve Shirt - Women's
review.reviewBody: feels like silk and keeps me cool
review.name: love this - so cool & comfty

name: Capilene Cool Daily Short-Sleeve Shirt - Women's

hasVariant.description: Buy the Vittoria Competition Latex Road Tube online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Three out of four of these tubes popped/punctured in the same place at the base of the valve stem during initial install, including one installed by a professional at a reputable bike shop. Nothing was wrong with the wheel rim or install process; these are just extremely fragile.
review.name: Fragile / Defective

review.reviewBody:
I am committed to latex inner tubes but there are downsides. They cost more, they will wear out - if the tube is getting stretched in spots replace it, you can patch them but you can't always find the leak. 
One additional bonus I s that the contrasting color makes it easier to make sure they are properly installed before inflation. 
I think these are acceptable trade offs.
review.name: More supple = less effort

review.reviewBody:
I'm writing this review because I've had a different experience than the others here. Maybe this is a bad batch/good batch situation (I purchased it in late 2022). Anyways, these have been stellar tubes. To start with, yes, they do slowly leak air. However, this is a characteristic of latex inner tubes, which you must consider if you decide to run them. This is no different than maintaining a tubeless setup, where you must add air before each ride.

Yes, they are faster than butyl tubes. There is a lot of research online about this subject, and the general consensus is that latex with high-performance tires is roughly the same efficiency-wise as tubeless. I personally prefer latex because I'm not too fond of the mess, and have found clincher tires far easier to mount. There's no way I could ever go back to butyl: the difference in rolling resistance is pretty apparent.
review.name: 1k + Miles so far

review.reviewBody: This is also a review for latex tubes in general, but specifically for this tube. It loses over 1 psi per hour, which is unacceptable to me, as my rides are mostly well over three hours. I'm not interested in refilling my tires more often than one a day at most. As a point of reference, the Tubolito tubes lose maybe 1 psi in two days.
review.name: Unacceptable

review.reviewBody:
I use these with Bontrager Aeolus wheels that are 38mm in depth. Valves fit and allow extra room without the need for extensions.

I've never puncture popped one, but have popped a couple via carelessness. They allow for an incredible ride feel when set at the right pressure. Best thing next to tubeless.

Air loss on latex tubes is normal, I generally pump them up every other ride, if not every ride.
review.name: Best latex tubes out there

review.reviewBody:
Every single one of these Have had lately leaks from this same area and often the pieces are coming apart. These are not made well and I have trashed 5 so far and not a single one from a puncture. 

Edit: just installed the 6th and final one and it leaked straight out of the box. I don?t know why backcountry continues to sell this junk but I won?t be a customer at all if they keep selling it
review.name: Poorly made
comment: This year I've had similar issues with SEVERAL of these.  They seem to always fail near the stem where the black material is glued to the latex.  These used to be rock solid, supple, and puncture resistant for me, but this recent batch of deteriorated quality has made me sadly throw in the towel after throwing away money.
How much air loss are you seeing? It's normal to lose 15-20psi per 24hrs on latex tubes.

review.reviewBody: Latex Tubes are Worth every Penny ride so Good and you Feel the Road Better been Running Latex for 4 years Know that's all I Use.
review.name: Latex

review.reviewBody: I went the whole summer with these, paired with the Continental GP5000s, and experienced no flats, despite some hard bumps and rough surfaces. I was also able to keep a low tire pressure, which made for a more comfortable ride. Did they make me faster? Hard to say, but I felt faster.
review.name: Feel fast, no flats
comment: What tire pressure did you run?

name: Competition Latex Road Tube

hasVariant.name: Exie VT NGX Mountain Bike
hasVariant.description: Buy the Ibis Exie VT NGX Mountain Bike online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.description: Buy the Ibis Exie VT NGX Mountain Bike online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
Large fits just right at 5'9.5.  
Only one other fs back in 2004, so really this is like my first one. 
Mostly road rider who has raced hardtails.
FS has solved my back tiredness from the hts. 
DW link is proven. Ibis is proven. Not as corporate as the other guys. No questions there. 
Unexpected excellent acceleration and climbing. Small bump compliance is also excellent. Pretty light for an NGX build. I'll upgrade brakes cuz I don't love the feel, but I like old Avid mechanical disc so take that with grain of salt. 
Shifts great. Highly recommend SRAM for their durability at this pricepoint. 
Will race this next month and if I don't win, it's not the bike's fault. 
Color is subjective, but black matte is pretty depressing. Ibis should be a bit louder and bolder, because they are actually a kick-a company.
review.name: quick bike, modern FS

review.reviewBody: Snappy is the best term I can use for this bike. My previous bike had 140/125 mm travel and this one definitely gives you more trail feedback, generally in a good way. I upgraded the NX crank and it weighed in at 26.6 lbs with pedals and 2x bottle cages.
review.name: Snappy!

review.reviewBody: I love the bike. It is more efficient pedaling then my YT.
review.name: Sweet XC MTB

name: Exie VT NGX Mountain Bike

hasVariant.description: Buy the PEARL iZUMi Summit AmFib Pant - Men's online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
UPDATE:
After using these a couple of times I realized the waist is a joke.  It is really big with no way to tighten it up.  The pants are amazing.  They block wind, are warm, water resistant, and are exactly what I was looking for. 
The waist is so poorly designed it is hard to believe PI let this go.  The issue is they have two small Velcro tabs on the side.  They at the very least need to be twice as big/long as they are with stronger Velcro.  The waist has no elastic and no belt loops.  You cannot get the waist to stay up. I guess if you sized down a lot and made it so your legs are just being compressed then the waist may work.  But that really isn't the reason you are buying pants like these versus tights.  
I've come up with three solutions.  
One: use suspenders- I bought some sport suspenders on Amazon and am going to try that first.  
Two: go to a tailor and have belt loops added. 
Three: have the tailor add elastic to the back. 

I am hoping I don't have to get belt loops added, but I may.  

I hope in version 2.0 they figure the waist out because these pants could be five stars, but right now they are three.  

Many reviews say these run really big.  That is only true if you are a "skinny cyclist".  I find they run more like jeans.  I have huge legs, a big butt, and skinny waist.  My waist measures 34 and I always wear loose/relaxed fitting size 36 jeans to get over my legs and butt.  I ordered a size 36 for these.  The waist is a loose and it only has really small Velcro straps to cinch it down.   The legs fit perfectly and there is room to tuck in layers.  I think they nailed the sizing for "normies".  If you are a typical skinny cyclist then you should look to size down 1 or 2 sizes.   If you normally wear loose or relaxed pants they are true to size.
review.name: Great cold weather pants with a catch.

review.reviewBody:
Sizing is WAAAYY big I'm about a 32", thought about a 30", then read more reviews, went two full sizes smaller, to a 28"?!
And happy I did, sizing is perfect now, but is 3 to 4 inches off on the waist, can't wait for some some snow and colder temps!!
Really nice fit, made out some really great material, I have some Bib tights made out of this AmFib Material, good into the single digits for a few hours, tried and tested many times, Pi just works for me
review.name: Sizing an issue, but really great pants!

review.reviewBody: Other said it and its true. The sizing is 1-2 sizes too big.
review.name: Sizing is way off

review.reviewBody: This is definitely a better way to ride trail in the winter. Tights with a built in chamois and your summer riding shorts on top? Nah those days are over. This is way less restrictive but still tight enough to move on the bike and they look good without shorts. Biggest issue is from the fit in the pelvis they should fit better around the waist. I?ve never bought anything below a 34? this is the first 32? waist I?ve bought and they still are loose. The size is way off and needs to be improved but they are on to something. Pair these with your favorite winter riding boots and your set for teen temps
review.name: Ready to ditch tights and shorts?

review.reviewBody: Love these shorts. Super durable and the pocket fits my giant phone! I find that they run a little small. I'm 5'3, 135# and the 6 fits me great!
review.name: Great Pocket!

review.reviewBody: I emailed the website and they recommend I go with my normal size, but I read that they ran small, so I ordered a 10. It was comfy in the legs and glutes, but really big in the hips. Would have had to wear a belt. So, I figured maybe I should have gotten the 8. I ordered it and it was too tight to be comfortable mountain biking, in both the hips and everything else. Maybe these would work well a straighter body type? I am 5'11", 145 lbs, but have a narrow waist and wider hips.
review.name: Weird sizing
comment: This was very helpful.  I am 6? 145. I am not big in the hips or real barrow in the waist.  I am going to try the 8.  I love the pattern.

review.reviewBody:
I wanted to really like these! RUNS SMALL. 
I have both size 6 and size 8 in Shredly but almost never wear the size 8 because it feels too big. i ordered these in a size 6 and they are much tighter and smaller than Shredly, especially around the booty. Wanted to exchange, but they dont have the size 8 anymore so i just have to return :(
review.name: Runs small

review.reviewBody: I love my wild rye "the freel" shorts, but the fit of these were completely different. The material is less stretchy as well. I purchased a size 4 in the freel and they are almost a size too big. Ordered a size 2 in these and they were way too snug. I think next time I'll stick with the freel and just size down.
review.name: Disappointed

review.reviewBody: I love the patterns and material but gosh why is it impossible to find a good fitting bike short for women? These are a great fit around my waist but really snug and stretched in the hips, butt, and thighs. I?m a 4-6/27 in street clothes and the 8 in these was too tight. The 10 would have been way too big on the waist. Their freel shorts fit the same, couldn?t even tell the difference.
review.name: Poor fit

review.reviewBody: I am a female with long, skinny feet that are impossible to fit.  I had been searching for years for a new pair of hiking boots and was dreading the thought of breaking in a new pair. Then I discovered these! Yes, they are mens boots but the fit is super narrow and I could get a size long enough for my foot.  Out of the box, perfect!! I have about 75 miles on them now and haven't had any issues at all!  They are on the lighter side, so will have to see how they are with hiking in the snow - but so far, I am a very happy customer!
review.name: Love, love, love these hiking boots!

review.reviewBody:
I was happy when I first put them on. Lightweight, comfy, supportive… but as time and mileage has gone by these boots have just gotten better. Honestly I haven’t gotten to “hike” in them much but the wringer I’ve put them through on the farm is a torture test like none other. And the trail time I have been able to enjoy has been more enjoyable in these. 

At first I thought the 13 was going to be too big (I have big feet and I’ve been buying that size for a while) but it works great with fluffy hiking socks and the inevitable foot swell that happens. 

Overall I’m very happy with this purchase
review.name: Can’t say enough good

review.reviewBody: Back in the day, i had purchased Asolo hiking boots for a Sierra Club backpacking trip of about 60 miles in a 10 day high Sierra trip. I was a photo nut and brought too much gear. A small aluminum case with 4 lenses and a tri pod so i could make for a stable 7' high shot. Then you got 70lbs commissary gear to take of food and such on top of your own gear. One of us got helicoptered out. I had a sports background of training, you never cheap out on your feet. It's the base of your endurance. Today i use another brand from Asolo for major yard work and thought i would get another pair since these are quite old, 45 or so years. Asolo generally are a pricey brand. In the last decade or so i have gotten into Keens as my overall solid shoe brand. They are good but Asolo is superior so i thought i would treat myself to the ultimate best. I actually picked up new Keen boots along with a Asolo boot pair. Haven't gone on a hike or shoveled some dirt with them but just putting them on in the house making sure the fit is right. Asolo just knows what the foot really wants. Superior fit and comfort by far.
review.name: Perfect fit

review.reviewBody: Nicely made but unusually tight in the toe box. Had to send them back right out of the box.
review.name: Runs tight

review.reviewBody: These shoes are lightweight and super comfortable. I really like them.
review.name: Dry and light!

review.reviewBody: Previously I had the Asolo GTX boots. They lasted through some rough terrain.  These have a spot pealing off the sole after 4 wears.
review.name: Not Great Quality

review.reviewBody: Light weight, very supportive, great fit, good traction. Importantly, I do not feel the points of sharp rocks when stepping on them. I have only about 20 miles on them so can’t discuss longevity.
review.name: Excellent

review.reviewBody: I bought these about a week before our 2 week trip to Yellowstone, Glacier and Grand Tetons National Park. They were great for the most part. I broke them in wearing them at work throughout the week prior to leaving. I loved the way they looked and felt, but towards the end of the trip they did start getting uncomfortable. Now,  I needed to lose about 40lbs before the trip and we hadn't done that much on your feet activity in a 2 week span in a while. The only reason, I was reluctant on giving a 5 star rating, was I believe they cheaped out on the most pivotal buckle of the boot, which is the transition to go up the leg. Other than that it performed well.
review.name: True to experience

review.reviewBody: Been up 2 mountains and several hikes so far with these boots and they are excellent. Great ankle support and kept my feet nice and dry. Definitely woth the momey.
review.name: Great boots

review.reviewBody: Awesome boots!! They fit great and very comfortable!! I'm very happy, Awesome!!
review.name: Great hiking boots

name: Finder GV Hiking Boot - Men's

review.reviewBody: I ordered this over a month ago and it was delivered to the wrong address.  When re-ordered; I was sent something completely different.  Now I have not had any response from Back Country.  Very poor service.  I have not received any kind of a refund either.
review.name: Never received what I ordered

review.reviewBody:
The R1 Air Hoodie is my favorite in the R1 series! If you walk into our Gearhead office this winter, you're almost guaranteed to find someone wearing one. This jacket is so versatile and comfortable that I wear it all year 'round. It is great as a standalone with layers in spring and fall. It is one of the best active winter jackets I've ever worn. It regulates your temperature very well when cycling, ski touring, hiking, running or snowshoeing, while keeping the chill off in cold temperatures. It also excels as a layering piece under a shell. I love skiing with it, as I can pull the hood under or over my helmet on cold days. I love it the most on powder days!

The fit is true to size but slightly slim/flattering. I love it. It has room to layer under, the under arms aren't tight, and my favorite part is that the hand pockets sink in. That makes it extra comfortable. The fabric is very soft and if you hold it up to the light, you can see how breathable and airy it is. 

I love this jacket and wear it everywhere from the trail to work to the grocery store. If you have any questions about this jacket or any Patagoina products, feel free to reach out to me at amcclary@backcountry.com or 801-204-4562.
review.name: Wardrobe Staple

review.reviewBody:
I have amassed four of these- two hooded, two not. They are the perfect layer. I wear them for everything; at work (woodworking), walking the dogs, under a jacket for colder temps, under a Houdini for wet trail runs, or to sleep in at
elevation in fifteen degree temps. The fit is  perfect for me - especially like the longer torso length.
review.name: Obsessed- need an intervention

review.reviewBody: I ordered a medium size and I usually wear small or medium. Thus, I had never thought it would be tight but it's too tight arm and body.  I checked the label if I ordered a small size. I have to return it.
review.name: too small

name: R1 Air Full-Zip Hoodie - Women's

review.itemreviewed: Terra Microtex Bondcush Gel Tacky Bar Tape
review.reviewBody: This is the third time I've bought this tape for my gravel rig and overall I've been pretty happy. It's grippy with just the right amount of cushioning. My only pet peeve is the white lettering. I understand all handlebars are different, but it's dang near impossible to get the lettering uniformly spaced in a way that satisfies my OCD. So, with this in mind, you might want to wrap over the white letters and let the black letters show instead. Otherwise, the tape is perfect.
review.name: Great gravel tape

review.itemreviewed: Terra Microtex Bondcush Gel Tacky Bar Tape
review.reviewBody: This tape has it all - grippy, cushioned, smooth. Great choice for my build of a Kotter chrome frame from the 1980's. Thanks!
review.name: perfect

review.itemreviewed: Terra Microtex Bondcush Gel Tacky Bar Tape
review.reviewBody: This bar tape is terrible. Complete waste of money. I've used it for only 4-6 casual rides and it already has holes worn just behind the hoods. And no, this is not due to bad hand position - my bike fit is perfect. This stuff is simply made out of weak material. I expect more out of a a solid company like Fizik. Most bar tapes should be made to last at least a full season - fat chance for this stuff!
review.name: JUNK: Holes worn from just a few rides!

review.itemreviewed: Terra Microtex Bondcush Gel Tacky Bar Tape
review.reviewBody: A really good product.
review.name: Nice tape.

name: Terra Microtex Bondcush Gel Tacky Bar Tape

description: Buy the UGG Tasman X Rain Boot - Women's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Tasman X Rain Boot - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the UGG Tasman X Rain Boot - Women's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Order your regular size. I am a 9/9.5 depending on the brand and I order my Uggs in a size 9 and they fit great. These are comfy, cute and warm. Don't remove the sock, it's made specifically for the shoe. I went on a long walk in these and it wasn't as comfortable as the Ugg boots but maybe there's a breaking in period for these since they are rubber. I've only worn in light rain so far but they held up fine.
review.name: Cute, trendy for fall. Not made for long walks

review.reviewBody: I got these in the mail last week and have been wearing them to work since. They are pretty comfortable, but there are some minor issues. The insert liner that comes with the shoe already ripped on the back seam, and it hasn't been two weeks yet. I'm a bit disappointed because I can't buy the insert separately. I also can't wear the shoes without the insert because they are too big; fits perfect with the insert though.
review.name: I really like the shoes, but the liners did not hold up

review.reviewBody: I'll start by saying I LOVE this shoe, it's just tight. I should have went one size up for more room. I really just want a shoe I can slip on and wear to work and school
review.name: TIGHTT!

review.reviewBody: I work at a clinic and during winter, the, boots are too bulky. Comfortable and no holes.
review.name: I love the shoes

review.reviewBody: Very nice but not a true to size with bootie insert.
review.name: May want to size up

review.reviewBody: I tired on these shoes with the socks they come with and my foot couldn't even fit in. Then I put them on for the day without the socks and they felt very tight anround the top of my foot and to small. They also weren't comfortable. I am a size 8.5 in women's and in UGGS I always get an 8. I got the 8 in this pair but didn't seem to be the right fit. I can't return them but my son damaged the box. So I am left with these uncomfortable shoes. I will say the style and color was very beautiful.
review.name: Run Small/ Uncomfortable

review.reviewBody: I have black, blue and now geyser, they're very comfortable for work and stylish too! I have to take the insoles out because my feet literally overheat, it's great when I'm outside but when I get to work, I have to them out
review.name: This is my 3rd pair

review.reviewBody: They are absolutely adorable and true to size. I wear a size 5 and the 5 fit perfectly. I love the removable sock. They will be perfect for walking my dog in the winter and wearing out and about anytime anywhere. The removable sock is soft with a firm sole, but still flexible and very comfortable
review.name: I love these

review.reviewBody: At first I was hesitant, I wear a 7 normally but I ordered an 8 and I'm glad that I did! With and without the sock insole I love the fact that I have room, so I'm going to have them for a long time. I'm in Dental school, so they're perfect! They're soo comfy, so I have no complaints!
review.name: 10/10 definitely recommend!

review.reviewBody: The sock fits great but when you put the shoe on with the socks there no room It's way to tight I order a size 10 but I'm actually a 8.5 and the cut is way off
review.name: Not true to size
